Build id: 200405060200

When I try to open GEF's plugin.xml in the manifest editor, I can only view the
XML source, I cannot switch to another tab because I get the error message: "The
source page has errors. Other pages cannot be used until these errors are
corrected." I am unaware of any errors as we have been using the same plugin.xml
since 2/20/04, and the project works fine. It also loads into build 200404281424
just fine. 

Here is the exception in my log file that I suspect:

Let me know if you need the contents of the GEF plugin.xml or if there is some
change I am unaware of. Thanks.
Please attach the plugin.xml in question.

The attached file has the content two times (two root elements) as in:

<plugin>
   ...content
</plugin>
<plugin> 
   ...content
</plugin>

Therefore, the source does have errors.

Dejan, I think Bugzilla does that.  All patches attached to bug reports today 
were doubled.
A nice practical joke by the buggy demon.
*** Bug 62684 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 62795 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Fixed.

When computing the start/end of attributes and their values, we were using 
regex search within the element tag.  This was causing a problem with the gef 
plugin.xml because it contains attribute values containing backward slashes.

The other dup of this defect was failing similarly because some of its 
attribute values contained other regex chars like $.

All fixed up now.

Actually, this is worse than it seems... if I go to a launch configuration
page/plug-ins when I've got my editor into this state, select "Choose plug-ins
and fragments..." the plugin with this file has a red X and is marked "out of
sync".  If I launch, this plugin is not included...

Aha.  My bad.  This is actually a different problem.  There was an error in the
XML file...a start tag did not match an end tag...but this was not indicated in
any way.
